document_data.name: Torga Burduum
document_data.mainbody: '''Torga Burduum''' was a highly accomplished [[dwarf|dwarven]] master smith from [[Citadel Adbar]] who dedicated her life and unlife to honing her art and creating powerful magical items such as ''[[Torga's Pyre]]''.
document_data.Personality: Torga Burduum was dedicated to smithing and went across the world and reached for the [[planes]] in search of materials and skills to improve herself. She strove to create a legendary weapon that would live on forever and achieve greatness in the hands of a grand hero or a dread villain.
document_data.History:
Torga Burduum hailed from the ancient dwarven Citadel Adbar. It was there she developed her impressive skills and reached the status of a Master Smith. She assembled a group of loyal apprentices and ventured across the world searching for new skills, techniques, and materials to create even more powerful weapons that would be legendary. Failing to find something powerful enough to use in her craft, she turned to the arcane, searching for materials and inspiration from the planes.

Eventually, Torga and her group reached [[Izzaxu's Kiln]] in the [[Forlorn Cliffs]] of the [[Middledark]], the ancient abandoned site of countless [[drow]] summoning rituals. There, Toga uncovered arcane texts describing a creature called [[Izzaxu]], who was forged out of a [[fire elemental]] and was bound to the Kiln. Foolishly, Toga and her group broke the seals that were holding the elemental, thinking they would be able to control the creature. Izzaxu was too powerful for the dwarves and incinerated the dwarves as it exited the portal. Those who avoided the infernal flames fled through the caves, triggering the traps left behind by the drow, and met their doom after being trapped inside Izzaxu's Kiln.

Alongside her crew, she remained trapped inside the Kiln in the ghostly apparition form until [[Champion of the Burning Dawn]]'s arrival ''circa'' [[1490 DR]]. Torga greeted the heroes after telling them that she has lost all hope of salvation, feeling like the whole cavern was lost in time. She employed the Champion to help the ghostly dwarves to break the curse of their existence by defeating Izzaxu and finishing her greatest workâ€”''[[Torga's Pyre]]''. The Champion and the companions were able to defeat the elemental creature, allowing Torga Burduum to harness Izzaxu's heat and essence into her masterpiece. With their purpose fulfilled, the ghosts departed for the afterlife.
